CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg. 18, reads: "$10,000 Fire - Twenty-eight families, eight with a total of 31 children, were forced to flee, and veteran Fire Capt. Ollie Letzkus received minor injuries when a $10,000 fire, apparently caused by defective wiring, swept through a row of apartment houses in 1400 block of Our Alley, Tuesday afternoon. The Housing Authority housed the displaced persons for the night, and the American Red Cross began and is continuing aid to the victims of this fire in the Lower Hill redevelopment area.  - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Fire fighters loading equipment onto fire truck in 1400 block of Our Way, Lower Hill District
